message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM

The paper deals with the problem of recovering high dynamic range (HDR) from low dynamic range (LDR) panoramas captured with a regular camera. This involves image processing, computer vision, and machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also deals with outdoor lighting and environment maps, which are related to computer graphics and visualization, suggesting that cs.GR (Graphics) is another likely sub-category. The paper proposes a deep autoencoder framework for inverse tonemapping, which involves learning-based regression, suggesting that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category. The paper also mentions applications in image matching, which involves computer vision and machine learning techniques, suggesting that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with real photographs and synthetic data, which involves multimedia and image processing techniques, suggesting that cs.MM (Multimedia) is another likely sub-category.
